title: Consider adding Color and Time classes

content.raw:
Consider moving [`gazebo::common::Color`](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/56be256c4ba911e9ffb6fece23b0c51170f6dbdf/gazebo/common/Color.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default) / `ignition::common::Color` and [`gazebo::common::Time`](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/56be256c4ba911e9ffb6fece23b0c51170f6dbdf/gazebo/common/Time.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default) / `ignition::common::Time` here. 

While it can be argued that these are not strictly "math" concepts, we could draw a parallel to existing ignition math classes such as [`Temperature`](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/113/temperature-class/diff). They're basically different ways of storing numbers which have special semantics.

On a less important note, this could also benefit ign-msgs, which already depends on ignition-math and could provide [conversions](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/src/50124cfffb91edb73f471b37c807d3680949775c/include/ignition/msgs/Utility.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Utility.hh-30) for the `time` and `color` messages.
content.html:
Consider moving gazebo::common::Color / ignition::common::Color and gazebo::common::Time / ignition::common::Time here.

While it can be argued that these are not strictly "math" concepts, we could draw a parallel to existing ignition math classes such as Temperature. They're basically different ways of storing numbers which have special semantics.

On a less important note, this could also benefit ign-msgs, which already depends on ignition-math and could provide conversions for the time and color messages.
